context: The Estonian word 'igatahes' is an adverb that means 'anyhow,' 'anyway,' 'at any rate,' 'in any case,' or 'in any event.' It's used to express that something is true regardless of other considerations or circumstances. The word is formed from 'iga' (every) + 'tahes' (willing/wants), suggesting a meaning of 'in every case' or 'regardless of what happens'. It's commonly used to emphasize that a particular statement or situation holds true under any conditions.
